messageBody:
I did, but there are reasons to continue to use JUnit for our project.
One is that TestNG adds an additional Framework (we are not getting
away from JUnit, due to things like DBUnit), and another is that the
group has kind of had a rocky relationship with testing, and I think
the discipline of focusing on the Unit that JUnit brings is beneficial
in this case.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Malte Finsterwalder <malte@...> wrote:
>
>
> I don't know whether that's an option for you, but TestNG supports test
> groupings. Did you look into that?
>
> But I'm not sure I understand the way you plan to group tests...
> How do you decide, whether a test is run or not?
> How do you tell the system that you want to run the slow tests or that
> you don't want to run the slow tests now?
>
> Greetings,
> Malte
>
